Emma Elizabeth Drinkel Soeiro

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/7953107456849879
  • Última atualização do currículo em 23/07/2013

Emma Drinkel possui o título de bacharel e mestrado em Química pela universidade de Durham, Inglaterra (2007) e doutorado na area de Química Orgânica pela universidade de Zurich, Suíça (2011). Atualmente ela exerce a função de assistente docente na universidade de Zurich, Suíça. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2007 - 2011
Development of Novel Sulfoxide and P-Alkene Ligands for Use in Transition Metal Catalysis
Descrição: The project was focussed on the synthesis of novel chelating ligands with sulfoxides, phosphines and alkenes as the metal co-ordinating moeities. These ligands were then used to make organometallic complexes, which were tested for their catalytic activity in organic reactions. Good to excellent results were found when using these catalysts in rhodium catalysed 1,4-addition reactions and iridium catalysed hydroamination reactions. Outstanding results were found in terms of activity and enantioselectivity..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Emma Elizabeth Drinkel Soeiro - Integrante / Dorta, Reto - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Roche Research Foundation - Bolsa / University of Zurich - Auxílio financeiro.
2006 - 2007
Development of non-toxic catalysts for the synthesis of polylactide (PLA), a biodegradable polymer.
Descrição: This project focussed on finding a non-toxic catalyst that could be used on an industrial scale for the polymerisation of lactide to polylactide. Highly active and non-toxic catalysts were found. Methods to reduce the amount of colouring of the polymer resulting from the polymerisation process were also researched..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Emma Elizabeth Drinkel Soeiro - Integrante / Dr. Matthew Lunn - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Johnson Matthey - Auxílio financeiro.
